text: Christian F端hrer (5 March 1943 - 30 June 2014) was a German Protestant pastor. He was one of the main figures and organisers of the 1989 Monday demonstrations in East Germany. This led to the German reunification and the end of East Germany in 1990. F端hrer was born in Leipzig, Saxony. He grew up in Penig. He studied theology at the University of Leipzig from 1961 until 1966. He retired from his job as a pastor in 2008. F端hrer died from respiratory failure caused by lung disease on 30 June 2014 in Leipzig, aged 71. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1943 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Anti-communists Category:East German people Category:German political activists Category:German Lutheran pastors Category:People from Leipzig
title: Christian F端hrer
